trait.name: Plant Life
entries: Pollops are sentient plants which can, like most other creatures, control most of their body. Pollops don’t have legs or arms, but they stand on a bunch of thick tentacle like vines which they can use as arms for manipulating things as well. Because of this, they don’t have hands or fingers, but will still be able to manipulate most things normally that don’t directly need fingers to use. Also, they can hold quite a lot things at once, as they aren’t limited by two arms and hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 0.5 m, one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4+1}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Little Helper (Tiny, Sapient)
languages: *same as it's owner - can only speak simple frases

trait.name: Little Helper
entries: A mechanical version of any small animal, or a higher tech version of a commerical RC drone for example. It is around 200 grams and it is one of the variants below:

variant.name: Standard
entries:
The standard issue, and because of that the most stable.
For every 10 HP base it has, it gets 5 HP more.

variant.name: Flying
entries: It gets a flying speed equal to its walking speed.

variant.name: Heavy
entries:
The little helper is a massive ground based drone.
This is mosty because of extra armor that the hull has, and so it gains +1 AC en +2 natural DR.
It's weight is also doubled.

variant.name: Swift
entries:
The little helper is a very manouvrable ground based drone.
This is because it is especially made to move easily, and so it gains +1 AC and 0.5 meter extra movement.

variant.name: Other
entries: This Tiny Helper is unique, and is made in an unusual way.
The Tiny Helper can be slightly different than normal, which can be discussed with the DM.
